pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:5.1: 71. The training rule on walking behind
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were walking behind while giving teachings to people walking in front. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:7.2: “‘I will not give teachings while walking behind to anyone walking in front who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:8.1: One should not give teachings while walking behind to anyone walking in front who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect gives teachings while walking behind to someone walking in front who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:9.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:9.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:10.1: The eleventh training rule is finished.
